item.title: 波音公司达成临时劳资协议后股价上涨，可能避免大规模罢工
item.description: 周一，波音公司股价在美国股市盘前交易中上涨 3%，此前该飞机制造商与美国西北太平洋地区的一个工会达成了一项临时协议，避免了本周晚些时候可能发生的严重罢工。【原文：Boeing shares rose 3% in U.S. premarket trading on Monday after the planemaker reached a tentative deal with a union in the U.S. Pacific Northwest that could avoid a possible crippling strike later this week.】

item.title: 市场升温，对冲基金涌向日本
item.description: 在亚洲 4,000 亿美元的对冲基金行业中，日本一枝独秀，在其他地区基金纷纷关闭的同时，日本却吸引了大量基金发行，这表明 8 月份的剧烈波动并没有破坏日本资本市场的复苏。【原文：Japan has emerged as a standout in Asia's subdued $400 billion hedge fund sector, drawing fund launches while other regions suffer closures in an indicator that wild volatility in August has not derailed a revival in Japanese capital markets.】

item.title: 中国汽车销量连续第五个月下降
item.description: 周一的行业数据显示，8月份中国乘用车销量连续第五个月下降，但纯电动汽车和插电式混合动力汽车的销量有所增长，这得益于对驾驶者换购污染较重车辆的补贴。【原文：Passenger vehicle sales in China fell in August for the fifth straight month, industry data showed on Monday, though sales of all-electric and plug-in hybrid models rose, helped by subsidies for drivers trading in more polluting vehicles.】

item.title: 欧洲股市在经历一年多来最差周度表现后反弹
item.description: 上周五，欧洲基准股指创下一年多来的最差表现，本周欧洲股市开盘表现积极，投资者正在等待一系列经济数据，并预计欧洲央行将在本周晚些时候降息。【原文：European shares began the week on a positive note after the benchmark index saw its worst day in over a year on Friday, while investors await a slew of economic data and expect the European Central Bank to cut interest rates later in the week.】

item.title: 松下能源部门准备生产 4680 块电动汽车电池
item.description: 日本松下控股公司（Panasonic Holdings）的能源部门周一表示，该公司已完成了 4680 电动汽车电池的量产准备工作，将开始向汽车制造商供应这种电池。【原文：The energy unit of Japan's Panasonic Holdings has finalised preparations for the mass-production of its 4680 electric-vehicle batteries, the company said on Monday, as it seeks to start supplying the cell to automakers.】

item.title: 贸易紧张局势加剧，中国 8 月出口可能进一步放缓 - 路透社调查
item.description: 由于全球需求降温和贸易壁垒增加有可能使世界第二大经济体的亮点黯淡，中国 8 月份的出口增速可能是四个月来最慢的。【原文：China's exports likely grew at the slowest pace in four months in August, as cooling global demand and mounting trade barriers threaten to dim a bright spot in the world's second-largest economy.】

item.title: Big Lots 开始破产程序，向 Nexus Capital 出售业务
item.description: 美国折扣家居用品零售商 Big Lots 周一表示，该公司已获得 7.075 亿美元用于支持其运营，并将其业务出售给私募股权公司 Nexus Capital，因为该公司已启动破产保护程序。【原文：U.S. discount home goods retailer Big Lots said on Monday it has secured $707.5 million to support its operations and sell its business to private equity firm Nexus Capital, as it has initiated bankruptcy proceedings under Chapter 11.】

item.title: 欧洲 中国仍在忙于输出通货紧缩
item.description: 韦恩-科尔对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Wayne Cole】

item.title: 澳大利亚多米诺公司因 "误导 "日本市场的言论遭集体诉讼
item.description: 多米诺比萨企业周一表示，一家当地法律事务所向其送达了一份股东集体诉讼，其中指控这家澳大利亚比萨连锁店在日本的预期业绩方面存在误导或欺骗行为。【原文：Domino's Pizza Enterprises said on Monday it was served a shareholder class action by a local legal firm which includes an allegation that the Australian pizza chain engaged in misleading or deceptive conduct around its expected performance in Japan.】

item.title: 华兴资本停牌 17 个月后股价暴跌，前董事长被拘留
item.description: 精品投资银行华兴资本（China Renaissance）在因时任董事长兼首席执行官包凡被调查而停牌 17 个月后于周一恢复交易，其股价跌幅高达 72%，创下历史新低。【原文：Shares of boutique investment bank China Renaissance fell as much as 72% to a record low on Monday when they resumed trading 17 months after being suspended during a probe involving its then-chairman and CEO Bao Fan.】

item.title: 受墨西哥湾沿岸暴风雨影响，油价跳涨 1 美元，大跌后有所回升
item.description: 由于潜在的飓风系统逼近美国墨西哥湾沿岸，而且市场从上周五美国就业数据弱于预期后的大跌中恢复过来，石油期货周一早盘跳涨了一美元。【原文：Oil futures jumped by a dollar in early trading on Monday as a potential hurricane system approached the U.S. Gulf Coast, and as markets recovered from a selloff following weaker-than-expected U.S. jobs data on Friday.】

item.title: 中国 8 月份居民消费价格涨幅加快
item.description: 由于中国政府继续努力重振国内需求，8 月份中国居民消费价格上涨较快，而生产者价格通缩持续。【原文：China's consumer prices rose at a faster rate in August, while producer price deflation persisted, as Beijing maintained efforts to reinvigorate domestic demand.】

item.title: 美联储降息前景扑朔迷离，美元踌躇不前，日元下跌
item.description: 由于投资者对美联储本月晚些时候降息的规模犹豫不决，并期待本周的美国通胀数据能提供更多线索，美元周一维持在狭窄区间内波动，而日元则缩减了部分避险收益。【原文：The dollar held to tight ranges on Monday while the yen pared some of its safe-haven gains, as investors were undecided on the scale of a Federal Reserve rate cut expected later this month and looked to this week's U.S. inflation reading for more clues.】

item.title: 亚洲股市受华尔街跳水拖累，债券看涨
item.description: 周一，亚洲股市下滑，此前对美国经济可能下滑的担忧重创华尔街，同时拖累债券收益率和大宗商品价格走低，因为投资者避开风险资产，转而寻求更安全的港湾。【原文：Asian share markets slid on Monday after worries about a possible U.S. economic downturn slugged Wall Street, while dragging bond yields and commodity prices lower as investors avoided risk assets for safer harbours.】

item.title: 日本第二季度国内生产总值（GDP）增速下调，消费疲软考验日本央行政策
item.description: 日本第二季度经济增长速度略低于最初报告的速度，原因是企业和家庭支出下调，这表明下半年消费和央行加息计划将更加艰难。【原文：Japan's economy grew at a slightly slower pace than initially reported in the second quarter, hurt by downward revisions in corporate and household spending that point to a bumpier second half for consumption and the central bank's rate-hike plans.】

item.title: 早间竞价准备迎接猛烈抛售
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 西太平洋银行任命安东尼-米勒为新首席执行官
item.description: 澳大利亚西太平洋银行周一表示，已任命安东尼-米勒（Anthony Miller）为首席执行官兼董事总经理。【原文：Westpac has appointed Anthony Miller as chief executive officer and managing director, the Australian bank said on Monday.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，Couche-Tard 在 385 亿美元收购要约遭拒后将再次与 Seven & i 接洽
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周日援引知情人士的话报道，Alimentation Couche-Tard 计划告诉 7-Eleven 运营商 Seven & i Holdings，它仍希望寻求收购。【原文：Alimentation Couche-Tard plans to tell 7-Eleven operator Seven & i Holdings that it was still keen to pursue an acquisition, Bloomberg News reported on Sunday citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 据 CNBC 报道，诺福克南方公司董事会正在调查首席执行官涉嫌不当工作关系的问题
item.description: 据 CNBC 周日援引三位熟悉内情的人士的话报道，诺福克南方公司董事会正在调查首席执行官艾伦-肖（Alan Shaw）在工作场所有不正当关系的指控。【原文：Norfolk Southern's board is examining allegations that CEO Alan Shaw engaged in an inappropriate workplace relationship, CNBC reported on Sunday citing three people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: Bending Spoons 首席执行官称，交易后将裁员 75% WeTransfer
item.description: 意大利应用程序开发商 Bending Spoons 首席执行官卢卡-法拉利（Luca Ferrari）在周日的一份声明中表示，将裁减文件共享平台 WeTransfer 75% 的员工。【原文：Italian app developer Bending Spoons will lay off 75% of file-sharing platform WeTransfer staff, CEO Luca Ferrari said in a statement on Sunday.】

item.title: DirecTV 向 FCC 投诉迪斯尼反竞争行为
item.description: 卫星电视供应商 DirecTV 周日表示，该公司已向美国联邦通信委员会（FCC）提出申诉，指控华特-迪士尼公司未能真诚地进行谈判并从事反竞争行为。【原文：Satellite TV provider DirecTV has filed a complaint with the U.S. Federal Communications Commission (FCC), accusing Walt Disney of failing to negotiate in good faith and engaging in anticompetitive behavior, the company said on Sunday.】

item.title: 西雅图波音公司工人罢工后达成协议
item.description: 波音公司周日表示，已与代表西雅图工人的工会达成协议，结束了长达数周的谈判。【原文：Boeing said on Sunday it had reached an agreement with the union representing its Seattle workers, bringing weeks of negotiations to a close.】

item.title: 大众老板称欧洲市场在更激烈的竞争中萎缩
item.description: 大众汽车公司首席执行官正在推动这家德国汽车制造商在本土市场进行前所未有的削减，他表示，由于欧洲市场正在萎缩，而竞争却在加剧，因此需要进行变革。【原文：Volkswagen's CEO, who is pushing for unprecedented cutbacks in the German carmaker's home market, said change was needed because the European market is shrinking while competition is increasing.】

item.title: 中国计划允许部分地区设立外商独资医院
item.description: 中国周日表示，将允许在包括首都在内的全国九个地区设立外商独资医院，中国政府正努力吸引更多外商投资，以提振疲软的经济。【原文：China on Sunday said it would the allow the establishment of wholly foreign-owned hospitals in nine areas of the country including the capital, as Beijing tries to attract more foreign investment to boost its flagging economy.】

item.title: 中国对荷兰针对 ASML 芯片制造工具的新出口管制表示 "不满
item.description: 中国商务部周日发表声明称，中国对荷兰政府决定扩大对 ASML 芯片制造设备的出口管制 "感到不满"。【原文：China is "dissatisfied" with the Dutch goverment's decision to expand export controls on ASML chipmaking equipment, the Chinese commerce ministry said in a statement on Sunday.】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，马斯克的 xAI 公司正在洽谈特斯拉未来收入分成事宜
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周六报道，埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的人工智能初创公司xAI已经就特斯拉未来的收入分成进行了谈判，作为回报，马斯克的电动汽车制造商可以使用xAI的技术和资源。【原文：Elon Musk's AI startup xAI has held talks for a share in future Tesla revenue in return for giving Musk's electric vehicle maker access to xAI's technology and resources, the Wall Street Journal reported on Saturday.】

item.title: 美国财政部部长耶伦表示可能会见中国同行
item.description: 美国财政部长珍妮特-耶伦（Janet Yellen）周六表示，她可能很快会与中国财政部长再次会晤，下一届美国政府需要 "优先考虑和培育 "美中关系。【原文：U.S. Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said on Saturday that she may have another meeting soon with her Chinese counterpart and that the U.S.-China relationship needs to be "prioritized and nurtured" by the next U.S. administration.】

item.title: Downdetector 显示，数以千计的用户的 X 出现故障
item.description: 据停电跟踪网站 Downdetector.com 报道，社交媒体平台 X 周六遭遇停电。【原文：Social media platform X suffered outages on Saturday, according to outage tracking site Downdetector.com.】

item.title: 中国称其巨大市场对美国是机遇而非威胁
item.description: 据中国商务部报道，商务部副部长王受文周六在天津市举行贸易谈判时表示，人口众多的现代中国对美国来说是机遇而非威胁。【原文：A modern China with a huge population is an opportunity, not a threat, for the United States, China's Ministry of Commerce reported commerce vice minister Wang Shouwen as saying on Saturday as trade talks were held in the city of Tianjin.】

item.title: 雷诺首席执行官称，由于电动汽车销售放缓，汽车行业可能面临数十亿美元的罚款
item.description: 雷诺汽车公司首席执行官卢卡-德-梅奥（Luca de Meo）周六表示，由于电动汽车需求放缓，欧洲汽车行业可能因碳排放面临150亿欧元（174亿美元）的罚款。【原文：Europe's autos industry could face fines of 15 billion euros ($17.4 billion) for carbon emissions due to slowing demand for electric vehicles, Renault CEO Luca de Meo said on Saturday.】
